item.title: Dying Shopping Malls Are the Roman Ruins of Our Civilization
item.description: Big-box stores are beautiful once they have nothing to sell.

item.title: The N.B.A.’s TV Broadcasts Have Lost Their Spark. Can We Learn to Love Them Again?
item.description: Pro basketball has returned to NBC, its home during the glory days of the 1990s. But the sport and its audience have changed.

item.title: What to Know About Teen Sexual Development and S.S.R.I.s
item.description: There is basically no research that looks at the impact of antidepressants on emerging sexuality. Here are the key things we do know.

item.title: These Pumpkin Mini Muffins Are the Perfect Fall Breakfast
item.description: Adapted from a school kitchen, they’re all comfort.

item.title: My Kids Are Becoming Adults. Can I Stop Hiding What I Think About Their Father?
item.description: This man has financially abused me and done everything in his power to undermine my career and my well-being.

item.title: Can You Use Holiday Tea Towels for Normal Towel Stuff?
item.description: A ruling on a kitchen-décor dispute.

item.title: An Acquaintance Might Be a Racist. Do I Need to Drop Him?
item.description: I included him in an Instagram story before I knew. Should I have deleted it?

item.title: There’s Just Something Safe and Comforting About a Biscuit
item.description: Two Nashville bakers are lifting up their community with these flaky vegan biscuits, perfectly pitched for holiday tables.

item.title: Do Kink Encounters Have to Count as Cheating?
item.description: My desires won’t go away, but my partner’s not interested. Is there an ethical way to explore them?

item.title: Should You Dry Someone Else’s Abandoned Laundry?
item.description: A ruling on a dispute over wet clothing.

item.title: More Teens Are Taking Antidepressants. It Could Disrupt Their Sex Lives for Years.
item.description: Research on adults who take S.S.R.I.s shows they tamp down sexual desire. Why aren’t we studying what that could mean for adolescents who take them?

item.title: She Has Taken 30 Years to Write a 7-Part Novel About 1 Day. It’s a Sensation.
item.description: The Danish author Solvej Balle’s experimental opus reframes the tedium of contemporary life as a source of unexpected wonders.

item.title: Houses Collapsing Into the Sea? It’s Not as Baffling as It Looks.
item.description: Viewers seem baffled by viral videos of homes left to tumble into the ocean. But this is how we approach a growing range of “stranded” assets.

item.title: ‘It’s a Culture Now of Fear’: A Year of Chaos Inside the Justice Department
item.description: Sixty former staffers describe an environment of suspicion and intimidation within the nation’s most powerful law enforcement agency.
